text: We know the semester’s only just begun, but it’s already time to think about spring schedules! This spring, we’re offering our Intro to Digital Humanities and Social Sciences with @megsmith.bsky.social.

text: Read more about CODES at iris.siue.edu/codes, and find admissions and application info at www.siue.edu/diversity/co...
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Community-Oriented Digital Engagement Scholars is a gen ed pathway for students who are first gen, Pell-eligible, or historically underrepresented in their majors. It blends community collab, interdisciplinary inquiry, and digital humanities methods to equip students to wrestle with wicked problems.
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text:
We’ve got some big news: the CODES program has received a $1 million grant from the Mellon Foundation, which support its expansion over the next three years! Congratulations to Dr. Jessica DeSpain and her collaborators on this enormous achievement!

www.siue.edu/news/2024/08...

#DigitalHumanities
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text:
“At a time when DEI scholarship and programs are being challenged and undermined across the globe, the work of scholars such as Dr. Jessica DeSpain is more urgently needed than ever."

You can read the full award announcement at iarslce.org/2024awards
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Congratulations to IRIS co-director Dr. Jessica DeSpain! She's received the Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Award from the International Association for Research on Service-Learning and Community Engagement for her work with CODES, RISE-DH, the Recovery Hub, and more.
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text:
New article is out! (3 weeks ago, but I was in the mountains.) 

Check it out if you’re interested in medieval Ireland, humanities data, and/or critical data practices. And if you’re interested in contributing to the project, please get in touch! #DigitalHumanities

text: Hey #StLouis #DigitalHunanities folks, the St. Louis DH Showcase is next week, and you’re invited! The showcase will feature the work of high schoolers, undergraduates, and grad students from area institutions. Program and registration here: digital-humanities-showcase-2024.training.lindenwood.edu

text: It’s a busy week in IRIS! Today, you can find us at the History Department’s research-in-progress speaker series, where @megsmith.bsky.social will present on her digital project Litigating Irishness. #DigitalHumanities #IrishHistory #MedievalSky #EarlyModern
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: 52 hours and 15 minutes! That's the amount of time students have volunteered in IRIS this semester on crowdsourcing projects like Douglass Day and Mapping for Rapid Response. We appreciate you!
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Our Mapping for Rapid Response participants are hard at work, putting a core digital humanities skill to work to support relief efforts in areas impacted by natural disasters. #DigitalHumanities
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text:
Happening this Friday! If you’re in the area, join us for a roundtable on Creative and Critical Approaches to AI, featuring perspectives from digital humanities, English, instructional technology, and computer science.

#DigitalHumanities
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: I see the latest issue of IDEAH is on the website, which means I feel free to plug my latest article! Read about St. Louis’s digital landscape, challenges of integrating digital pedagogies into high schools, and some paths forward. #DigitalHumanities ideah.pubpub.org/pub/tm4w0adq...
author_display_name: dr. meg smith

text: Hello, Louisiana! I’m spending my spring break giving a talk on ethical approaches to DH at Grambling State! What a great conversation with a really thoughtful group of students. #DigitalHumanities
author_display_name: dr. meg smith

text:

- A workshop on mapping for rapid response (3/26)
- A research presentation on @megsmith.bsky.social’s Litigating Irishness (3/29)

text: The pictures from this event by @siueiris.bsky.social was exactly what I needed at the end of today. Happy birthday, Mr. Douglass!
author_display_name: Sherman Dorn

text: It was a wonderful, generative space with lots of collaboration and curiosity! If you haven’t already, you should go check out the other Douglass Day celebrations across the country - the folks at @digblk.bsky.social do such great work organizing the event!
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: And here are a few of the reflections our participants had after transcribing! #DouglassDay #DouglassDay2024
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Thanks to everyone who joined us for #DouglassDay! As of this evening, over 1000 pages have been transcribed by over 800 volunteers. We’re so glad our students and faculty got to contribute to that number! Enjoy these photos of the celebration. #DouglassDay2024
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text:
#DouglassDay is here! If you’re on campus, you can join the transcribe-a-thon in person in IRIS (Peck 2226) between 10:30 and 1:30.

If you can’t make it in person, you can still participate! Transcribe letters and review others’ transcriptions here: crowd.loc.gov/campaigns/tr...

#DouglassDay2024
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Join us on February 14 from 10:30 to 1:30 in the IRIS Center to celebrate #DouglassDay! We’ll transcribe a portion of Douglass’s correspondence and learn more about his life and legacy. (There will be cake too!) Sign up at bit.ly/iris-douglass
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Thanks to our wonderful presenters at last night’s Digital Humanities Student Showcase! We heard from 30 CODE Scholars and IRIS student researchers about digital projects on topics near and far. We’re so proud of the work these students are doing to critically and ethically engage with technology!
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Happy Halloween weekend! Did you know that jack-o-lanterns originated in Ireland as carved turnips, not pumpkins? In the 1930s, Irish schoolchildren recorded this and other folklore. Read more at Duchas, a digital humanities project that digitized the students’ work: www.duchas.ie/en/cbes/5008...
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: As we head toward final project season, don’t forget that IRIS offers office hours to support students and faculty working on digital humanities projects! Here’s our updated schedule for November.
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Read more about CODES at iris.siue.edu/codes
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text:
We are thrilled that our colleagues across the region recognize the labor, care, and intellectual experiences that SIUE students receive through Jessica’s work and the powerful impacts of integrating digital humanities, student-led research, and community engagement!
#DigitalHumanities #SIUE
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: These activities have helped them think holistically about their communities – both the local community in which they live and learn and the digital communities that equally shape their identity, belonging, and sense of place.
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Working in small, student-led research teams, they have used text analysis and data visualization to analyze rhetoric about climate change; written for the web to disseminate their findings with a general audience; and created ePortfolios to reflect on their learning outcomes.
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Students learn digital technologies through their coursework, which they apply both formatively and summatively as they work alongside their community partners to address thorny problems with both local and global manifestations.
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text: Jessica was recognized for her work as creator & director of the NEH-funded Community-Oriented Digital Engagement Scholars program, which uses tech to cultivate rich academic experiences, belonging, and relationships to the local community among Black, Latinx, Pell-eligible, and first-gen students.
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences

text:
Hello world!

We’ll kick off our Bluesky with some good news and an intro to one of our projects:

We’re very happy to share that our co-Director Jessica DeSpain (@jessicadespain.bsky.social) received the Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity Award from the Focus on Teaching and Technology Conference! 1/
author_display_name: IRIS Center for Digital Humanities and Social Sciences
